text: A ninja on a surfboard killing robots while this music plays... this definitely made Stage 4 a highlight in the game. Shinobi III is my favorite game in the series, it's a greatly entertaining action platformer. I liked how it wasn't too hard, though I remember the last stage giving me some problems.

text: I really love this rocking song. ¬†I have not played a game from this series, but maybe I could play it someday. ¬†Also Gabe, what games have you been playing lately? ¬†Just wondering.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. I'm starting to really slow down on Diablo 3's expansion, now I'll start playing Dragon Quest III on the SNES and Dust: An Elysian Tale. Should be fun!
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky¬†You will really like Dust, ¬†It is a great Metroidvania that I think you will enjoy. ¬†The music is really good too done by Alexander Brandon, ¬†Speaking of Metroidvanias, I've been playing Guacamelee and really enjoying it. ¬†I'm almost finished with it too. ¬†I might have to start playing Dust again as I was really enjoying it.
author: Eric C.

text: @SupraDarky¬†Yeah, Dust is a very good game. The one gripe I had about it was the art style, but that's just me of course. Other than that the game has really smooth combat and a pretty descent story!
author: StackedJack

text:
@SupraDarky
¬†What are your thoughts on Alexander Brandon's music Gabe? I don't recall seeing you posting it on Best VGM too much. Also, have you listened to some of Brandon's music that's not made for video games? He has a bandcamp, and you can listen to his albums there. Era's End is my favorite.

text: If you like Dust you may consider giving something else a try. A game that was well loved in times past has recently risen from the grave, Dungeon Fighter Online. Not only is the gameplay in this game great, but I think you will find the composers for the game were no slouches either.
